SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

io
Class UserReader

java.lang.Object
  io.UserReader

public class UserReader
extends java.lang.Object

Parses a file containing all the users and their preferences. Blank lines and lines starting with "%" are ignored. Information is organized using case-sensitive tags.

The representation of a new user on the file starts with the "USER" tag on its own line. The next 3 lines are interpreted as the user name, user id, and password.

If the user is a Student, the "STUDENT" tag should follow on its own line. The next line should contain a list of days the student would be willing to go to school (see TimeSlotReader.parseDayString()). The line after that should be a comma-separated list of times of day the student would be willing to go to school, being either "MORNING", "EVENING", or "MORNING,EVENING". Finally, the next line should be a comma-separated list of course IDs of Courses the Student would like to attend.

If the user is a Instructor, the "INSTRUCTOR" tag should follow on its own line. The next line should contain a list of days the instructor would be willing to teach (see TimeSlotReader.parseDayString()). The line after that should be a comma-separated list of times of day the instructor would be willing to teach, being either "MORNING", "EVENING", or "MORNING,EVENING". Finally, the next line should be a comma-separated list of course IDs of Courses the Instructor would be willing to teach.

If the user is a Advisor, the "ADVISOR" tag should follow on its own line. The next line should be a comma-separated list of course IDs of Courses the Advisor recommends be on the Schedule.

If the user is a Scheduler, the "SCHEDULER" tag should be on its own line.

Data must be read using the read method before other methods may be used. Data may be read only once, effecively making instances immutable.



Invariants:

  • none

Version:
May 27, 2011: Class created.
Author:
Jonathan Caddey

Method Detail

read

public void read(java.util.Scanner the_scanner)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Reads a given file containing information about all the users. See class documentation on how the file should be organized.

Preconditions:
  • the_scanner has input in the correct format
  • the_scanner != null
Postconditions:
  • all user information is read in

Parameters:
the_scanner - contains the user data in the correct format.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if data has already been read.

parseStudentPreferences

protected StudentPreferences parseStudentPreferences(LineCommentScanner the_scanner)
                                              throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                     InputFormatException
Constructs a StudentPreferences object from the information retrieved from the Scanner. The position of the input is advanced to after the method finishes reading information.

Preconditions:
  • the_scanner != null
  • The next lines contain a comma-delimited list of preferred Days, a comma-delimited list of preferred times, and a comma-delimited list of course IDs for preferred courses.
Postconditions:
  • none

Parameters:
the_scanner - can read the required input.
Returns:
an object holding the information read from input.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_scanner is null.
InputFormatException - if the_scanner's input is not formatted as described.

parseCourseString

protected java.util.Collection<Course> parseCourseString(java.lang.String the_string)
                                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a collection of all the Courses corresponding to the course IDs found in the given string. Course IDs should be separated by commas.

Preconditions:
  • the_string != null
  • the_string is as described
  • every course ID in the_string is a key in the Map given upon construction.
Postconditions:
  • the Course for every recognized course ID is in the returned list.

Parameters:
the_string - contains course IDs separated by commas.
Returns:
the Courses corresponding to the course IDs in the_string.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_string is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an unrecognized course ID is in the_string.

parseGeneralTimeString

protected java.util.Collection<GeneralTime> parseGeneralTimeString(java.lang.String the_string)
                                                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Given a string of times of day separated by commas, returns a Collection of GeneralTimes that represent those times of day.

Preconditions:
  • Every time of day in the_string is the toString() output of a GeneralTime.
  • the_string != null
Postconditions:
  • none

Parameters:
the_string - fits format as described above.
Returns:
the GeneralTimes represented in the_string.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_string is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a time in the_string does not match the toString() output of a GeneralTime.

getUserMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,User> getUserMap()
Returns a mapping of user IDs to the Users they belong to. The Users are those represented in the file passed to the last successful read invocation.

Preconditions:
  • read(File) has been called
Postconditions:
  • TODO

Returns:
a mapping of user IDs to the Users they belong to.
